Module downfall
Package net.dragondelve.util

Class Configurator

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.dragondelve.downfall.util.Configurator
  • public final class Configurator
extends java.lang.Object
    Non Instantiable configurator class that is responsible for loading, and storing the Configuration of the program.

      • setUserRealm

        public void setUserRealm​(Realm realm)
        Relatively lightweight accessor method, overrides all fields of the original final reference to userRealm
        Parameters:
        realm - realm whose values are going to override the current values of userRealm

      • findMaterialTemplate

        public VisualMaterialTemplate findMaterialTemplate​(Material material)
        Searches the list of all VisualMaterialTemplates in the currently loaded ruleset for a matching id of a given material.
        Parameters:
        material - material that has an id set to represent a specific template.
        Returns:
        VisualMaterialTemplate that is associated with that material. If none found returns null.

      • loadConfiguration

        public void loadConfiguration()
        Loads configuration from CONFIG_PATH defined in this class.

      • saveConfiguration

        public void saveConfiguration()
        Saves configuration to an XML file at CONFIG_PATH defined in this class

      • loadRules

        private Rules loadRules​(java.lang.String pathname)
        Loads rules from a specific provided pathname.
        Parameters:
        pathname - pathname to an xml file where rules to be downloaded are located.
        Returns:
        rules that have been loaded. If loading from pathname fails, returns defaultRules isnted.

      • saveRules

        public void saveRules()
        Saves currently applied rules to an XML file at DEFAULT_RULES_PATH defined in this class

      • saveRules

        public void saveRules​(java.lang.String pathname)
        Saves currently applied rules to an XML file at a given pathname
        Parameters:
        pathname - pathname to a file that can be written.
